Description: Fragment of wall of East Greek black-figured, probably closed, pottery vase. Below, reserved area; above, on black ground, incised scale pattern terminating below in points; white at centre of scales.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

From same vase as Alexandria 17041, 17113 and 17174. Venit compares a krater fragment, Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA62, but the similarity is not apparent, save for the probable use of scale-pattern.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 19, no. 63b pl. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.902)
